reviewText:
As the description of the game above says, this is a spooky thrillling third-person point&click adventure.

I will not reveal much of the story because the meaning of the game is discovering what’s going on around you.

1)Just some tidbits:
You are a sort of P.I., straight coming out from the ’80/’90 with his long dark coat, sunglasses always worn even if the sun has skipped totally over the city and his tough manners and rough voice, who is trying to find out what’s happened to his girlfriend.
Retracing some of her action, he will bump in to strange characters that sometimes will give him a hand (even secretly) sometimes will just ignore him (even if they have other plans in mind). Where is she? Is she still alive?
Play it and find out...

2)Gameplay:
The red hotspot indicates the object (or character) with which you can interact. The right button of the mouse gives you some description of what you are observing (that appears at the top of the screen); some objectes require a close scrutiny when they are in your inventory (at the bottom of your screen). Some of them can also be combined.
Collect everything, it could come in handy later (all has a purpose!)
At the start of the game you are given a folder and a strange coin: don’t forget to dip in to it..you never know what clues can come through!
During the game you will find a map that shows the main buildings and clicking on them will move you there immediatly.
When you try to use something on a red hotspot, if it’s the right thing, it will wobble..but sometimes even if it’wobbling, it will not fit..so it may be of help having an ample point of view and using your wits.
Don’t let any “dark corner” goes unchecked because the answer.. can be in plain sight..

Being Last Half of The Darkness a saga, if you want to have the whole picture of its story, you have to start from “Shadows of the Servant” then “Beyond the Spirit’s Eye, “Tomb of Zojir” and “Society of the Serpent Moon”.

I like these games because their plots are good and engaging; the puzzles and riddles are comprehensible and the gameplay is easy and neat.

So my rating for them is 8/10

reviewText: This is an adventure game in the style of Sierra Online's original 'Quest' titles, like King's Quest, Space Quest and Police Quest. No previous knowledge of prior 'Last Half of Darkness' games is required to play or to understand the storyline.  In order to find and save your girlfriend from a dark cult, you explore various fixed-camera scenes in a seedy town for clues. I found the puzzles fun and solving them was great satisfaction for a player who is normally stumped on games like this with without a walkthrough. The most difficult aspect for me was finding all the objects that are needed as tools in other locations. Be sure to search every nook and cranny for usable items.\n\nThis steam package also includes a free copy of Tomb of Zojir and 3 other games.  Tomb of Zojir is a 'must play' for fans of the genre and is worth the price of admission alone!
